title: Anders Dahl (equestrian)
text:
Anders Dahl (born 11 March 1976) is a Danish Olympic <a href="dressage">dressage</a> rider. He competed at the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a> where he finished 30th in the <a href="Equestrian%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Individual%20dressage">individual</a> and 6th in the <a href="Equestrian%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Team%20dressage">team competition</a>.
Dahl also competed at the <a href="2006%20World%20Equestrian%20Games">2006 World Equestrian Games</a>, placing 4th in team dressage. In 2008, he participated at <a href="Dressage%20World%20Cup">Dressage World Cup</a> final in <a href="Den%20Bosch">Den Bosch</a> where he finished 10th.
He is married to the fellow dressage rider <a href="Fiona%20Bigwood">Fiona Bigwood</a>.
In 2016, Dahl and his wife relocated from Bourne Hill House in <a href="Horsham">Horsham</a> in <a href="West%20Sussex">West Sussex</a> to <a href="Brantridge%20Park">Brantridge Park</a> where they have established an equestrian centre.
